revised_title: Nitrogen Cycling in Upland Pastures: A Comprehensive Overview
tldr: This article examines the nitrogen cycle in upland pastures, focusing on the factors that influence its availability and cycling. It discusses the inputs, outputs, and circulation of nitrogen in these ecosystems, including precipitation, livestock, leaching, and burning. The study highlights the complex interplay of climate, soil properties, and human activities in maintaining the balance of nitrogen in upland pastures.
